dadMessages.spark: Son, you've got the spark. Now let's go check the tire pressure.

dadMessages.varsity: Incredible. Almost as good as my '92 Varsity touchdown.
dadMessages.grillMaster: That's it. You're the new Grill Master.
dadMessages.blockParty: Mythic?! Call the neighbors, we're having a block party.

privacy.dad_quote: Son, I've been reading the terms and conditions since 1987. Still on page 1.
privacy.summary_point_1: 100% free - No accounts, no payments, no personal information
privacy.summary_point_2: All data stored locally on your device (LocalStorage)
privacy.summary_point_3: Optional analytics that respect your privacy
privacy.summary_point_4: No data selling, sharing, or tracking across websites
privacy.overview_content: At DadDeck‚Ñ¢, we take your privacy as seriously as a dad takes his lawn care routine. This privacy policy explains how we handle your data when you use our free trading card simulator. Spoiler alert: We don't collect much, and what we do collect stays on your device.
privacy.data_content: We believe in minimal data collection. Here's what we gather:
privacy.localstorage_content: We use your browser's LocalStorage to save your card collection, deck configurations, and game preferences. This data lives ONLY on your device - we never see it, touch it, or send it anywhere. It's like your dad's workshop: organized, private, and nobody else knows where anything is. Technical details: We store collection data (cards, packs opened, deck configurations) and user preferences (theme, language, audio settings) in LocalStorage with automatic quota management.
privacy.analytics_content: We use privacy-focused analytics to understand how people use DadDeck‚Ñ¢. This helps us improve the game without compromising your privacy. We track: Page visits (anonymously), Feature usage (which features get used most), Performance metrics (load times, errors). We DO NOT track: Personal information, Individual user behavior across sessions, Your location or device fingerprint. You can opt-out of analytics anytime in your browser settings or by using privacy extensions.
privacy.browser_content: Like all websites, your browser automatically sends basic technical information: Browser type and version, Operating system, Screen resolution, Language preference. This is standard web functionality that helps us display the site correctly on your device. We don't store or analyze this data separately.
privacy.usage_content: We use your data for exactly three things: (1) Saving your game progress so you don't lose your collection when you close the browser. (2) Improving the game experience based on analytics. (3) Ensuring the site works correctly on your device. That's it. No advertising targeting, no profile building, no creepy tracking.
privacy.sharing_content: No. Never. Not now, not ever. Here's what we DON'T do: We don't sell your data to advertisers. We don't share your data with third parties. We don't use data brokers. We don't track you across other websites. The only exception is legal: If required by law, we may comply with valid legal requests. But let's be honest - you're opening digital card packs, not plotting world domination.
privacy.rights_content: Since your data lives on your device, you have complete control over it:
privacy.access_content: Your collection and settings are stored in your browser's LocalStorage. You can view them anytime by opening your browser's developer tools (F12) and navigating to the Application tab ‚Üí Local Storage.
privacy.deletion_content: Want to start fresh? Clear your browser's LocalStorage for this site, and your data will be completely deleted. Just like that time your dad "organized" the garage by throwing everything away. In most browsers: Right-click ‚Üí Inspect ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Local Storage ‚Üí Right-click ‚Üí Clear.
privacy.optout_content: Don't want to be counted in our analytics? No problem! Use your browser's privacy settings, install a privacy extension (like uBlock Origin or Privacy Badger), or disable JavaScript (though the game won't work without it). We respect your choice completely.
privacy.security_content: Since all data lives on your device, security is largely in your hands. Here's what we do on our end: (1) Use HTTPS encryption for all data transmission. (2) Follow security best practices in our code. (3) Regularly update dependencies to patch vulnerabilities. What you should do: (1) Keep your browser updated. (2) Use a secure device (not a public computer). (3) Clear your data if you use a shared device.
privacy.children_content: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ is family-friendly and suitable for all ages. Since we don't collect personal information, we don't need parental consent. But if you're a parent concerned about your child's online privacy: (1) All data is stored on your child's device, not our servers. (2) We don't track or profile users. (3) You can clear the data anytime by clearing browser LocalStorage. (4) Teach your child about online privacy - it's never too early to learn!
privacy.changes_content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal reasons. When we make significant changes, we'll update the 'Last Updated' date at the top of this page. Continued use of DadDeck‚Ñ¢ after changes means you accept the new policy. (But let's be honest - since we don't collect much data, changes will be rare and minor.)
privacy.contact_content: Have questions about this privacy policy or how we handle data? Want to report a privacy concern? You can reach us at: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ Privacy Team - privacy@daddeck.tcg (Note: This is a hypothetical contact email for the privacy policy. In production, replace with actual contact method.) We'll respond to legitimate privacy inquiries within a reasonable time. Though, like a dad returning emails, it might take us a few days.
privacy.dad_joke: Why did the dad read the entire privacy policy? Because he didn't want any surprises, just like when he checks the restaurant menu before ordering!

terms.dad_quote: I didn't read the terms and conditions, but I'm pretty sure it says I'm always right.
terms.summary_point_1: Free to use - No payments, no subscriptions, no hidden fees
terms.summary_point_2: Satirical content - All cards and content are for parody and humor
terms.summary_point_3: Respectful use - Be kind to other players and enjoy the game responsibly
terms.summary_point_4: No warranties - Use at your own risk, like attempting to fix your own plumbing
terms.overview_content: By using DadDeck‚Ñ¢, you agree to these Terms of Service. If you don't agree with these terms, please don't use the website. It's like when dad says 'My house, my rules' - except this is our website, and these are our rules. Don't worry, they're pretty reasonable.
terms.satire_content: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ is a satirical trading card game that parodies suburban American dad culture. All content is created for humor, entertainment, and social commentary purposes.
terms.satire_fictional_content: All dad characters, cards, abilities, and scenarios depicted in DadDeck‚Ñ¢ are entirely fictional and created for satirical purposes. Any resemblance to actual dads, living or dead, is purely coincidental and (let's be honest) probably pretty flattering. We're celebrating dad stereotypes with love and laughter, not mockery.
terms.satire_stereotypes_content: Our game relies on affectionate parody of common dad archetypes (BBQ Dad, Couch Dad, Fix-It Dad, etc.). These stereotypes are used for comedic effect and are not intended to promote, reinforce, or demean any group. Think of it like a loving roast - we're laughing because we relate, not to be mean.
terms.satire_humor_content: The humor in DadDeck‚Ñ¢ is meant to be lighthearted and fun. If any card or content offends you, remember: (1) It's all in good fun. (2) We're making fun of everyone, including ourselves. (3) You don't have to play or collect cards you don't like. (4) Take a deep breath - it's just a game about silly dad stereotypes.
terms.usage_content: To keep DadDeck‚Ñ¢ fun for everyone, please follow these guidelines:
terms.usage_age_content: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ is suitable for all ages, but we recommend players be at least 13 years old. Younger players should have parental supervision. Why? Because some of the humor might go over kids' heads, and we don't want to explain dad jokes to a confused 8-year-old.
terms.usage_conduct_content: Be excellent to each other. Don't use DadDeck‚Ñ¢ to: (1) Harass, bully, or abuse other players. (2) Post offensive, illegal, or inappropriate content. (3) Exploit bugs or cheat (we have anti-cheat measures, but still). (4) Try to break the game or ruin others' experience. Basically, don't be 'that guy' at the block party.
terms.usage_prohibited_content: You may not: (1) Reverse engineer or attempt to extract the game's source code. (2) Use bots or automated scripts to open packs (except our official batch opening feature). (3) Sell or trade accounts or collections for real money. (4) Use DadDeck‚Ñ¢ for any illegal purpose. (5) Create derivative works without permission. Violation may result in a permanent ban - and dad will be very disappointed.
terms.ip_content: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ and all related content (card designs, artwork, text, logos, game mechanics) are owned by us and protected by copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws. You may: (1) Play the game for free. (2) Share screenshots and card pulls on social media. (3) Create fan content (with proper attribution). You may NOT: (1) Copy or redistribute our code or assets. (2) Use our branding without permission. (3) Create commercial products based on DadDeck‚Ñ¢. If you want to collaborate, contact us - we're dads, we're negotiable.
terms.user_content_content: If you share content related to DadDeck‚Ñ¢ (social media posts, fan art, videos, etc.), you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use it for promotional purposes. You still own your content - we just might share it because we think it's cool. We'll always credit you. If you don't want us to share your content, just let us know.
terms.disclaimer_content: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ is provided 'AS IS' and 'AS AVAILABLE' without warranties of any kind, express or implied. We don't guarantee: (1) The site will be available 100% of the time (servers nap, just like dads). (2) The site will be error-free or secure (we try, but bugs happen). (3) Any specific results from using the game (RNG is RNG, sometimes you pull trash cards). Use DadDeck‚Ñ¢ at your own risk. We're not responsible for: (a) Damages to your device from using the site. (b) Lost collections from clearing browser data (back up your stuff!). (c) Emotional distress from pulling bad packs (we've been there, it hurts).
terms.liability_content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, DadDeck‚Ñ¢ and its creators shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use or inability to use the game. This includes: (1) Lost profits (if you're somehow profiting from free card packs). (2) Lost data (back up your browser storage regularly). (3) Emotional distress from bad pulls. Our total liability to you shall not exceed the amount you paid to use DadDeck‚Ñ¢ (which is $0.00, so... good luck).
terms.termination_content: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your access to DadDeck‚Ñ¢ at our sole discretion, without prior notice, for any reason, including but not limited to: (1) Violation of these Terms. (2) Abusive behavior toward other players or our team. (3) Attempting to exploit or harm the game. (4) Being a total buzzkill. Upon termination, your right to use the game will immediately cease. We may also delete your account data (if we add accounts in the future). Don't make us do it - we're dads, we hate disappointment.
terms.changes_content: We may update these Terms of Service from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, legal requirements, or because we thought of something funnier. When we make changes, we'll update the 'Last Updated' date at the top of this page. Continued use of DadDeck‚Ñ¢ after changes means you accept the new terms. We'll notify players of significant changes through: (1) In-game notifications. (2) Updates to our website. (3) Social media posts. (4) Dad telepathy (okay, not really, but sometimes it feels like it).
terms.contact_content: Have questions about these Terms? Want to report a violation? Need to tell us we're wrong (we're not, but we'll listen)? Reach out to us at: DadDeck‚Ñ¢ Legal Team - legal@daddeck.tcg (Note: This is a hypothetical contact email for legal inquiries. In production, replace with actual contact method.) We'll respond to legitimate inquiries within a reasonable time. Just don't expect us to understand TikTok references - we're trying our best.
terms.dad_joke: Why did the dad agree to the Terms of Service without reading them? Because he trusts his gut, just like when he buys a used car from a guy named Dave!
